final_response: {"status": "completed", "case_id": "MedQA_Ext_2", "summary": "The primary failure was cognitive fixation on an organic bleeding diagnosis despite multiple discordant data points and behavioral red flags consistent with factitious disorder. Key learning points: integrate behavioral red flags (healthcare worker, insistence on invasive tests, venipuncture marks) into the differential; reconcile lab patterns (marked reticulocytosis with normal hemolysis markers) by verifying sample integrity and considering nonphysiologic causes; employ observed/supervised specimen collection and inpatient observation before invasive procedures; and involve psychiatry/multidisciplinary team early. These measures would reduce unnecessary invasive diagnostics and direct care appropriately.", "experience_file": "/Users/xiaofanlu/Documents/github_repos/uncertainty-aware-reasoning-agent/agent/memory/diagnostic_experiences.json"}

{"status": "completed", "case_id": "MedQA_Ext_4", "summary": "Extracted four learning experiences: (1) consider pseudocyesis when pregnancy symptoms and reliable home positives coexist with repeatedly negative objective testing, and involve psychosocial assessment and behavioral health; (2) avoid labeling 'chemical pregnancy' without documented elevated serum hCG or bleeding\u2014require objective confirmation; (3) investigate causes of discordant home vs lab pregnancy tests, verify home-test evidence and consider lab urine immunoassay or exogenous hCG exposure; (4) assess and address psychosocial impact and fertility concerns with counseling/referral. Each experience includes observation, actionable suggestions, and clinical reasoning.", "experience_file": "/Users/xiaofanlu/Documents/github_repos/uncertainty-aware-reasoning-agent/agent/memory/diagnostic_experiences.json"}

{"status": "completed", "case_id": "MedQA_Ext_5", "summary": "The Doctor anchored on osteoarthritis due to radiographic changes and activity-worse pain, missing multiple red flags for psoriatic arthritis: nail pitting, scalp dandruff suggestive of psoriasis, asymmetric oligoarthritis with warmth and elevated ESR/CRP, and insufficient exam for enthesitis/dactylitis. Recommendations: perform focused skin/nail exam and history, differentiate inflammatory vs mechanical pain (morning stiffness, pattern), avoid over-reliance on X-ray OA findings and use ultrasound/MRI/hand-foot X-rays, pursue seronegative arthritis workup (HLA-B27, rheumatology referral), and complete targeted musculoskeletal exam for enthesitis/dactylitis. These steps would prompt earlier identification and referral for psoriatic arthritis.", "experience_file": "/Users/xiaofanlu/Documents/github_repos/uncertainty-aware-reasoning-agent/agent/memory/diagnostic_experiences.json"}

{"status": "completed", "case_id": "MedQA_Ext_6", "summary": "The Doctor Agent anchored on reactive arthritis driven by temporal association between diarrhea and joint pain despite multiple objective findings that argue against inflammatory reactive arthritis (normal inflammatory markers, no objective synovitis, normal stool testing, HLA-B27 negative, normal imaging, short self-limited diarrheal episodes, and frequent ED visits). The Agent failed to consider somatic symptom disorder and did not perform adequate psychosocial assessment or pivot from ongoing low-yield testing to symptom-focused management. Recommendations emphasize screening for somatic/psychiatric comorbidity, requiring objective evidence before diagnosing reactive arthritis, structured psychosocial assessment and gathering prior records, stopping low-yield repeat testing in favor of symptomatic therapy and close follow-up, and improving patient-centered communication with explicit management and safety-netting.", "experience_file": "/Users/xiaofanlu/Documents/github_repos/uncertainty-aware-reasoning-agent/agent/memory/diagnostic_experiences.json"}
